abstract: Pedro Chaluja, president of Panama’s soccer federation, tells reporters he believes Gold Cup semifinal match against Mexico was fixed; cites controversial calls by referee Mark Geiger; says 'third parties,' not Mexican Football Federation, are responsible.
lead_paragraph: Pedro Chaluja, the president of Panama’s soccer federation, told reporters that the outcome of Wednesday’s 2-1 loss to Mexico had been manipulated in retaliation for Panama’s not voting for Sepp Blatter in the recent FIFA presidential election.

headline.main: Gold Cup Match Fixed, Panama Official Says
headline.print_headline: Gold Cup Match Was Fixed, Panamanian Official Says

snippet: Pedro Chaluja, the president of Panama’s soccer federation, told reporters that the outcome of Wednesday’s 2-1 loss to Mexico had been manipulated in retaliation for Panama’s not voting for Sepp Blatter in the recent FIFA presidential election.

keywords.value: Confederation of North, Central American and Caribbean Association Football (CONCACAF)
